content.title: Negative Pressure Wound Therapy (NPWT)
content.definition: A wound healing technology that applies controlled subatmospheric pressure to wounds through a sealed dressing, promoting granulation tissue formation and wound contraction.

clinical_features.chronic: Diabetic ulcers, pressure ulcers, venous ulcers

concepts.definition: When NPWT should not be used.

clinical_features.absolute: Untreated osteomyelitis, malignancy in wound, necrotic tissue with eschar
clinical_features.relative: Exposed vessels or organs, bleeding disorders, anticoagulation

clinical_features.foam: Open-cell polyurethane foam cut to wound size
clinical_features.instillation: Some systems allow topical solution instillation

clinical_features.evidence: Level I evidence for diabetic foot ulcers
clinical_features.cost: Higher initial cost but may reduce overall healing time
